workflow.name: fluidX THE EYE ‚Äî Create & invite via SMS for live camera session
workflow.description:
### Setup & Instructions ‚Äî fluidX: Create Session, Analyze & Notify

**Goal:**  
This workflow demonstrates the full **fluidX THE EYE** integration ‚Äî starting a live session, inviting both the **customer** (via SMS) and the **service agent** (via email), and then accessing the media (photos and videos) created during the session.  
Captured images are automatically analyzed with AI, uploaded to an external storage (such as **Google Drive**), and a media summary for the session is generated at the end.

![THEEYE.png](fileId:3276)

- The **agent** receives an email with a link to join the live session.  
- The **customer** receives an SMS with a link to start sharing their camera.  
- Once both are connected, the agent can view the live feed, and the system automatically stores uploaded images and videos in Google Drive.  
- When the session ends, the workflow collects all media and creates a complete AI-powered **session summary** (stored and updated in Google Drive).

Below is an example screenshot from the customer‚Äôs phone:  
![User.jpeg](fileId:3278)

---

### Prerequisites
- **Developer account:** [https://live.fluidx.digital](https://live.fluidx.digital) (activate the **TEST plan**, ‚Ç¨0)
- **API docs (Swagger):** [fluidX.digital API](https://live.fluidx.digital/api/swagger.html)

---

### üîê Required Credentials

**1Ô∏è‚É£ fluidX API key (HTTP Header Auth)**  
‚Ä¢ Credential name in n8n: `fluidx API key`  
‚Ä¢ Header name: `x-api-key`  
‚Ä¢ Header value: `YOUR_API_KEY`

**2Ô∏è‚É£ SMTP account (for outbound email)**  
‚Ä¢ Credential name in n8n: `SMTP account`  
‚Ä¢ Configure `host`, `port`, `username`, and `password` according to your provider  
‚Ä¢ Enable TLS/SSL as required  

**3Ô∏è‚É£ Google Drive account**  
‚Ä¢ Used to store photos, videos, and automatically update the session summary files.  

**4Ô∏è‚É£ OpenAI API (for AI analysis & summary)**
‚Ä¢Used in the Analyze Images (AI) and Generate Summary parts of the workflow.
‚Ä¢ Credential type: OpenAI
‚Ä¢ Credential name (suggested): OpenAI account 
‚Ä¢ API Key: your OpenAI API key
‚Ä¢ Model: e.g. gpt-4.1, gpt-4o, or similar (choose in the OpenAI node settings)

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration (in the ‚ÄúSet Config‚Äù node)
- `BASE_URL`: `https://live.fluidx.digital`  
- `company` / `project` / `billingcode` / `sku`: adjust as needed  
- `emailAgent`: **set before running** (empty in template)  
- `phoneNumberUser`: **set before running** (empty in template)

---

### Flow Overview
`Form Trigger ‚Üí Create Session ‚Üí Set Session Vars ‚Üí Send SMS (User) ‚Üí Send Email (Agent) ‚Üí Monitor Media ‚Üí Analyze Images (AI) ‚Üí Upload Files to Google Drive ‚Üí Generate Summary ‚Üí Update Summary File`

The workflow starts automatically when a **Form submission** is received.  
Users enter the **customer‚Äôs phone number** and **agent‚Äôs email**, and the system creates a new **fluidX THE EYE session**.  
As media is uploaded during the session, the workflow automatically retrieves, stores, analyzes, and summarizes it ‚Äî providing a complete end-to-end automation example for remote inspection, support, or field-service use cases.

---

### Notes
- Do not store real personal data inside the template.  
- Manage API keys and secrets via n8n **Credentials** or environment variables.  
- Log out of [https://live.fluidx.digital](https://live.fluidx.digital) in the agent‚Äôs browser before testing, to ensure a clean invite flow and session creation.

meta.templateTitle: fluidX ‚Äî Create Session & Notify (API Integration Example)
meta.templateDescription: Creates a production-ready fluidX THE EYE session, delivers SMS/email invites, deduplicates media polling, adds AI-based labels, and syncs photos plus rolling summaries to Google Drive.
meta.templateInstructions:
# üìù Setup ‚Äî fluidX THE EYE Session Automation

## 1. Accounts & Docs
- Create a developer login at https://live.fluidx.digital (TEST plan is free)
- Review the API reference: https://live.fluidx.digital/api/swagger.html

## 2. Required Credentials in n8n
1. `fluidx API key` (HTTP Header Auth ‚Üí header `x-api-key`)
2. SMTP account for outbound email notifications
3. Google Drive OAuth2 credential (for uploads)
4. Optional: OpenAI credential if you want AI photo captions

## 3. Configure the "Set Config" node
- `BASE_URL`: keep `https://live.fluidx.digital`
- `company` / `project` / `billingcode` / `sku`: set to your production identifiers
- `language`: controls the OpenAI caption language (default `DE`)
- `message`: SMS intro text; the customer link is appended automatically
- Phone/email fields come from the built-in form each run, so no personal data is stored in the workflow

## 4. Run Flow
Form Trigger ‚Üí Create Session ‚Üí Set Session Vars ‚Üí Google Drive folder ‚Üí Send SMS ‚Üí Send Email ‚Üí Wait for live feed ‚Üí Poll `/api/revxr/ext/session` for `photoRefs` ‚Üí Skip already processed photos via workflow static data ‚Üí Download ‚Üí Analyze (optional OpenAI) ‚Üí Upload media + captions to Drive ‚Üí Fetch `/api/fx/ext/media/summary`, convert to text, and keep the latest summary file per session.

## 5. Operational Notes
- All HTTP request nodes reference the `fluidx API key` credential so you can rotate keys centrally.
- Workflow static data is cleared after each run to avoid leaking media IDs between sessions.
- Replace the Google Drive folder ID with your own shared workspace before publishing.
- Use environment variables or n8n Credentials for any other secrets you add.

Happy streaming! üöÄ

parameters.content:
### Setup ‚Äî Create a fluidX revXR THE EYE session

**Goal:** Invite the customer via SMS and the service agent via email so both join the fluidX THE EYE session and share their cameras live.

1. Sign in at https://live.fluidx.digital (activate the TEST ABO plan, ‚Ç¨0) and create your API key.
2. Review the API docs: https://live.fluidx.digital/api/swagger.html.
3. In n8n add credentials:
   - fluidX API key (HTTP Header Auth ‚Üí header x-api-key)
   - SMTP account for outbound email.
   - OpenAI key
   - Google Drive API
4. Open the "Set Config" node ‚Äî the defaults are ready to test; adjust other values if needed (the form collects the phone and email each run).
5. Run the flow: Submit the form ("On form submission") ‚Üí Create Session ‚Üí Set Session Vars ‚Üí Create Drive folder ‚Üí Send SMS ‚Üí Send Email.
6. Create a THEEYE folder in your Google Drive root.

Tips:
- Keep secrets inside n8n credentials or environment variables.
- Use demo data while testing; swap to production values when ready.
- Log out of live.fluidx.digital in the agent's browser before testing to ensure the invite flow opens a clean session.

parameters.content:
### If the Session is closed: Get the media summary
fluidX API GET /api/fx/ext/media/summary
Upload the final Summary to the Google Drive

nodes.name: fluidX API - Media Info HTTP Request GET

parameters.text: =What's in this image? Output language is {{ $('Set Config').item.json.language }}

string.name: title

nodes.name: fluidX API - Download Photo THEEYE Session
fluidX API - Media Info HTTP Request POST

parameters.content:
### Get session information
fluidX API GET /api/revxr/ext/session

### Create THE EYE session
Invite the user via SMS and the agent via email.

### Retrieve the media information
fluidX API GET /api/revxr/ext/media/info

### Download the image via photoRefs
Use the photoRefs download URL. If there is no MediaInfo, it is a new image captured on the customer's device.

### Analyze the image
Use the `Analyze Image` node (or your preferred vision model) to extract insights.

### Create Media Info
fluidX API POST /api/revxr/ext/media/info
Document the AI findings back into the session payload.

### Upload image and MediaInfo
Store both assets in your Google Drive THEEYE folder.

### Prepare image information
Extract the image references: download URL and ID.

### The end
Clean up remaining assets and wrap up the session.

main.node: fluidX API - Media Info HTTP Request GET
fluidX API - Media Info HTTP Request POST
fluidX API - Download Photo THEEYE Session

user.name: Olaf Titel
user.bio: Senior Software Architect and Technical Leader with 20+ years of experience building secure, scalable, cloud-native platforms. Formerly at T-Systems, Volkswagen, and Gematik. Co-founder & CTO of fluidX.digital, a browser-based AR/video collaboration platform using WebRTC and pixel streaming. Expert in architecture, DevOps, CI/CD, and data-driven cloud solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
